oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hermitage Church
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: View of Andrew Jackson's brick church located on the grounds of The Hermitage. Sleeve reads, Partially burned Feb. 20, 1963.

Built in 1823 by Andrew Jackson for his wife. The Hermitage, home of President Andrew Jackson, is a Greek Revival mansion built in 1819, enlarged in 1831, and rebuilt after an 1834 fire, furnished largely with pieces owned by Jackson.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Calvert, Peter Ross, 1855-1931; Calvert, Ebenezer, 1850-1924
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Architecture; Historic buildings; Religious architecture
Churches; Religious facilities; Estates
